did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Georgetown Community Association Collection contains records of the activities of the Georgetown Community Association.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the G&B Cultural Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item Description, Date], Georgetown Community Association Collection, [Item no., Box no.], G&B Cultural Center, Wilton, Conn.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Georgetown Community Association (GCA) was founded in 1934. According to its bylaws, the GCA is dedicated to "the promotion, preservation and improvement of the best historical, residential and commercial character" of Georgetown. It seeks to achieve these ends through "cultural, literary, benevolent and charitable" endeavors. Projects the GCA has overseen in Georgetown include the reconstruction of the WWI Veterans Memorial Park, the restoration of the Batterson and Osborne Cemeteries, the rededication of Boundary Rock, and advocating for the continued appropriate use of the Gilbert & Bennett School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Georgetown Community Association Collection contains meeting minutes, bylaws, membership information, and correspondence of the GCA. It includes reports and other information on proposed development plans for the Gilbert & Bennett Mfg. Co. mill site, as well as papers related to the GCA's involvement in advocating for the continued appropriate use of the Gilbert & Bennett School, including petitions, posters, opinion surveys, newspaper clippings, maintenance reports, and copies of leases with former tenants of the school. Finally, papers relating to the formation and expansion of the Georgetown National Historic District can be found in the collection.
